title: What is something that can be used to trick a touchpad into responding besides your fingers and a special stylus? - Quora

response.answer_text: Take a Q-Tip, dip it in a mild salt solution, remove excess liquid until it's just moist and it’ll work as well as your finger. When people work with alcohol-based products (Isopropyl , not the drinkable type), it drys the oils in your skin so the touchscreen won't work, or doesn't work as well. So people use the Q-Tip trick.
Aluminium Foil/Tin Foil can work . You can make stylus by your own too through pen , aluminium foil , earbud and a tape.  You can also use a battery cell .
